alert.note: Alert for Berks; Chester; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 10:36PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Berks, Chester and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1035 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen at some locations, with an additional inch of rain possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Reading, West Chester, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Coatesville, Westtown, Wyomissing, Downingtown, Kennett Square, Birdsboro, Oxford, and Kutztown. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 323. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 11. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
